If `m` and `n` are natural numbers, then the natural number `m^n` is even
if and only if `m` is even and `n` is positive.

type: ∀ {m n : ℕ}, Even (m ^ n) ↔ Even m ∧ n ≠ 0
name: Nat.even_pow
docString:
If `m` and `n` are natural numbers, then the natural number `m^n` is even
if and only if `m` is even and `n` is positive.

For all natural numbers n and m, (n + 1) * m = n * m + m.

type: ∀ (n m : ℕ), n.succ * m = n * m + m
name: Nat.succ_mul
docString: For all natural numbers n and m, (n + 1) * m = n * m + m.

This theorem states that for any two natural numbers `m` and `n`, if `m` is less than or equal to `n`, then `m` squared (i.e., `m` multiplied by itself) is also less than or equal to `n` squared (i.e., `n` multiplied by itself). In mathematical notation, this states that ∀ m, n ∈ ℕ (m ≤ n → m² ≤ n²).

type: ∀ {m n : ℕ}, m ≤ n → m * m ≤ n * n
name: Nat.mul_self_le_mul_self
docString: This theorem states that for any two natural numbers `m` and `n`, if `m` is less than or equal to `n`, then `m` squared (i.e., `m` multiplied by itself) is also less than or equal to `n` squared (i.e., `n` multiplied by itself). In mathematical notation, this states that ∀ m, n ∈ ℕ (m ≤ n → m² ≤ n²).

A natural number `n` is a sum of two squares if and only if `n = a^2 * b` with natural
numbers `a` and `b` such that `-1` is a square modulo `b`.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, (∃ x y, n = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2) ↔ ∃ a b, n = a ^ 2 * b ∧ IsSquare (-1)
name: Nat.eq_sq_add_sq_iff_eq_sq_mul
docString:
A natural number `n` is a sum of two squares if and only if `n = a^2 * b` with natural
numbers `a` and `b` such that `-1` is a square modulo `b`.

For any natural number `m >= 2` and `n`, the sum of `m` raised to the power of each natural number less than `n` equals `(m ^ n - 1) / (m - 1)`.

type: ∀ {m : ℕ}, 2 ≤ m → ∀ (n : ℕ), ((Finset.range n).sum fun k => m ^ k) = (m ^ n - 1) / (m - 1)
name: Nat.geomSum_eq
docString: For any natural number `m >= 2` and `n`, the sum of `m` raised to the power of each natural number less than `n` equals `(m ^ n - 1) / (m - 1)`.

A natural number `n` is expressed as a sum of two squares if and only if `n` can be written as the product of the square of a natural number `a` and another natural number `b`, such that `-1` is a perfect square in the multiplication group modulo `b`. That is, there exists some `r` such that `(-1) = r * r (mod b)`.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, (∃ x y, n = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2) ↔ ∃ a b, n = a ^ 2 * b ∧ IsSquare (-1)
name: Nat.eq_sq_add_sq_iff_eq_sq_mul
docString: A natural number `n` is expressed as a sum of two squares if and only if `n` can be written as the product of the square of a natural number `a` and another natural number `b`, such that `-1` is a perfect square in the multiplication group modulo `b`. That is, there exists some `r` such that `(-1) = r * r (mod b)`.

If `-1` is a square modulo coprime natural numbers `m` and `n`, then `-1` is also
a square modulo `m*n`.

type: ∀ {m n : ℕ}, m.Coprime n → IsSquare (-1) → IsSquare (-1) → IsSquare (-1)
name: ZMod.isSquare_neg_one_mul
docString:
If `-1` is a square modulo coprime natural numbers `m` and `n`, then `-1` is also
a square modulo `m*n`.

The integers modulo `n : ℕ`.

type: ℕ → Type
name: ZMod
docString: The integers modulo `n : ℕ`.

If all the elements of a finset of naturals are less than `n`, then the sum of their powers of
`m ≥ 2` is less than `m ^ n`.

type: ∀ {m n : ℕ} {s : Finset ℕ}, 2 ≤ m → (∀ k ∈ s, k < n) → ∑ k ∈ s, m ^ k < m ^ n
name: Nat.geomSum_lt
docString:
If all the elements of a finset of naturals are less than `n`, then the sum of their powers of
`m ≥ 2` is less than `m ^ n`.

Multiplication by `(n + 1 : ℕ)` behaves as expected.

type: ∀ {M : Type u} [self : AddMonoid M] (n : ℕ) (x : M), AddMonoid.nsmul (n + 1) x = AddMonoid.nsmul n x + x
name: AddMonoid.nsmul_succ
docString: Multiplication by `(n + 1 : ℕ)` behaves as expected.

A (positive) natural number `n` is a sum of two squares if and only if the exponent of
every prime `q` such that `q % 4 = 3` in the prime factorization of `n` is even.
(The assumption `0 < n` is not present, since for `n = 0`, both sides are satisfied;
the right hand side holds, since `padicValNat q 0 = 0` by definition.)

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, (∃ x y, n = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2) ↔ ∀ {q : ℕ}, Nat.Prime q → q % 4 = 3 → Even (padicValNat q n)
name: Nat.eq_sq_add_sq_iff
docString:
A (positive) natural number `n` is a sum of two squares if and only if the exponent of
every prime `q` such that `q % 4 = 3` in the prime factorization of `n` is even.
(The assumption `0 < n` is not present, since for `n = 0`, both sides are satisfied;
the right hand side holds, since `padicValNat q 0 = 0` by definition.)

If `-1` is a square modulo the natural number `n`, then `n` is a sum of two squares.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, IsSquare (-1) → ∃ x y, n = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2
name: Nat.eq_sq_add_sq_of_isSquare_mod_neg_one
docString: If `-1` is a square modulo the natural number `n`, then `n` is a sum of two squares.

`m >>> n` produces an integer whose binary representation
is obtained by right-shifting the binary representation of `m` by `n` places

type: ShiftRight ℤ
name: Int.instShiftRight_mathlib
docString:
`m >>> n` produces an integer whose binary representation
is obtained by right-shifting the binary representation of `m` by `n` places

A single variable `n` is represented by a sum with coefficient `1` and monomial `n`.

type: ℕ → Linarith.Sum
name: Linarith.var
docString: A single variable `n` is represented by a sum with coefficient `1` and monomial `n`.

If the natural number `n` is a sum of two squares of coprime natural numbers, then
`-1` is a square modulo `n`.

type: ∀ {n x y : ℕ}, n = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 → x.Coprime y → IsSquare (-1)
name: ZMod.isSquare_neg_one_of_eq_sq_add_sq_of_coprime
docString:
If the natural number `n` is a sum of two squares of coprime natural numbers, then
`-1` is a square modulo `n`.

If `-1` is a square modulo `n` and `m` divides `n`, then `-1` is also a square modulo `m`.

type: ∀ {m n : ℕ}, m ∣ n → IsSquare (-1) → IsSquare (-1)
name: ZMod.isSquare_neg_one_of_dvd
docString: If `-1` is a square modulo `n` and `m` divides `n`, then `-1` is also a square modulo `m`.

The multiplicity of `m` in `n` is the number of positive natural numbers `i` such that `m ^ i`
divides `n`. This set is expressed by filtering `Ico 1 b` where `b` is any bound greater than
`log m n`.

type:
∀ {m n b : ℕ},
  m ≠ 1 → 0 < n → Nat.log m n < b → emultiplicity m n = ↑(Finset.filter (fun i => m ^ i ∣ n) (Finset.Ico 1 b)).card
name: Nat.emultiplicity_eq_card_pow_dvd
docString:
The multiplicity of `m` in `n` is the number of positive natural numbers `i` such that `m ^ i`
divides `n`. This set is expressed by filtering `Ico 1 b` where `b` is any bound greater than
`log m n`.

If `n • x = 0`, then `m • x` is the same as `(m % n) • x`

type: ∀ {M : Type u_4} [inst : AddMonoid M] {a : M} {n : ℕ} (m : ℕ), n • a = 0 → m • a = (m % n) • a
name: nsmul_eq_mod_nsmul
docString: If `n • x = 0`, then `m • x` is the same as `(m % n) • x`

The natural number less than `lcm n m` congruent to `a` mod `n` and `b` mod `m`

type: {m n a b : ℕ} → a ≡ b [MOD n.gcd m] → { k // k ≡ a [MOD n] ∧ k ≡ b [MOD m] }
name: Nat.chineseRemainder'
docString: The natural number less than `lcm n m` congruent to `a` mod `n` and `b` mod `m`

A natural number `m` divides the sum `m + n` if and only if `m` divides `n`.

type: ∀ {m n : ℕ}, m ∣ m + n ↔ m ∣ n
name: Nat.dvd_add_self_left
docString: A natural number `m` divides the sum `m + n` if and only if `m` divides `n`.

Any nonzero natural number is the product of an odd part `m` and a power of
two `2 ^ k`.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, n ≠ 0 → ∃ k m, Odd m ∧ n = 2 ^ k * m
name: Nat.exists_eq_two_pow_mul_odd
docString:
Any nonzero natural number is the product of an odd part `m` and a power of
two `2 ^ k`.

A natural number `m` divides the sum `n + m` if and only if `m` divides `n`.

type: ∀ {m n : ℕ}, m ∣ n + m ↔ m ∣ n
name: Nat.dvd_add_self_right
docString: A natural number `m` divides the sum `n + m` if and only if `m` divides `n`.

All `m`, `0 < m < n` are `n`-smooth numbers

type: ∀ {m n : ℕ}, 0 < m → m < n → m ∈ n.smoothNumbers
name: Nat.mem_smoothNumbers_of_lt
docString: All `m`, `0 < m < n` are `n`-smooth numbers

The natural number less than `n*m` congruent to `a` mod `n` and `b` mod `m`

type: {m n : ℕ} → n.Coprime m → (a b : ℕ) → { k // k ≡ a [MOD n] ∧ k ≡ b [MOD m] }
name: Nat.chineseRemainder
docString: The natural number less than `n*m` congruent to `a` mod `n` and `b` mod `m`
